intro: Sticherus milnei, commonly known as the narrow-leafed flax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and arranged in clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Sticherus milnei is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
